meanings.definition: The quality or state of being smudgy.
meanings.sent1: The smudginess of the drawing made it look messy.
meanings.sent2: I tried to clean the smudginess off the window with a cloth.
meanings.sent3: The smudginess on the mirror made it seem like a ghost had passed by.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was clouded with a smudginess that made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The smudginess of the photograph gave it a vintage feel.

meanings.definition: The tendency to create smudges or smears.
meanings.sent1: His hands were always covered in smudginess after working with charcoal.
meanings.sent2: The little child's smudginess on the walls showed where they had been playing.
meanings.sent3: The smudginess of the cake frosting made it look like a work of abstract art.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush moved with a smudginess that added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The smudginess of the ink on the paper created a unique pattern.

meanings.definition: The appearance of being dirty or blurred due to smudging.
meanings.sent1: The smudginess on the glasses made it hard to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph had a certain smudginess that added to its charm.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly blamed the smudginess on her glasses for her typos.
meanings.sent4: The smudginess of the painting gave it an ethereal quality.
meanings.sent5: The smudginess of the window made the view outside seem dreamlike.
